meanings.definition: Control or manage every part, however small, of (an enterprise or activity)
meanings.sent1: She tends to micromanagement her team's tasks, making sure every detail is perfect.
meanings.sent2: The supervisor decided to micromanagement the project, overseeing every step of the process.
meanings.sent3: The robot boss took micromanagement to a whole new level, even checking the color of the post-it notes.
meanings.sent4: Her micromanagement was like a puppeteer pulling strings, dictating every move the team made.
meanings.sent5: The image of her micromanagement was etched in their minds, a constant reminder of her control.

meanings.definition: Excessive control or attention to minor details
meanings.sent1: The manager's micromanagement stifled creativity in the team, leaving no room for innovation.
meanings.sent2: Employees often feel demotivated under the weight of constant micromanagement.
meanings.sent3: The office prankster decided to play a joke on the boss by labeling everything with 'micromanagement'.
meanings.sent4: The cloud of micromanagement hovered over the department, casting a shadow on productivity.
meanings.sent5: The toxicity of micromanagement poisoned the work environment, leading to high turnover rates.
